nodes.name: Check if new files or updated files1

parameters.toolDescription:
Loads the complete text content of a document based on its file_id.

INPUT:
- file_id: 64-digit SHA256 hash (from List Documents or RAG hits)

RETURNS:
- document_text: Merged full text of all text sections

WHEN TO USE:
- After RAG search, if hits are fragmentary
- After List Documents, to load complete content
- When a file is explicitly requested

WORKFLOW:
1. Determine file_id via List Documents or RAG search
2. Call Get File Contents with file_id

DO NOT USE FOR:
- Files only on GitLab (‚Üí GitLab Get File)
- Tabular evaluations (‚Üí Query Document Rows)
- Unknown file_ids (determine first via List Documents)
parameters.query:
SELECT 
    string_agg(text, ' ') as document_text
FROM documents
  WHERE metadata->>'file_id' = $1
GROUP BY metadata->>'file_id';

parameters.toolDescription:
Searches the RAG system to look up information in the knowledge base.
Always call with JSON {‚Äúinput‚Äù:‚Äú<query>‚Äù.

parameters.formDescription: Gebe den Dateipfad der Datei aus dem GtiLab Projekt ein, das in das RAG-System √ºbertragen werden soll.

parameters.query:
CREATE TABLE document_metadata (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    title TEXT,
    url TEXT,
    project TEXT,
    owner TEXT,
    branch TEXT,
    last_modified TIMESTAMPTZ,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    schema TEXT
);

parameters.toolDescription:
Select rows from a table in Postgres Lists all documents in the RAG system. Use to determine file_id or check file existence.

RETURN:
- id: 64-digit SHA256 hash (= file_id)
- title: File name
- url: File path in the repository
- project: Project name (ai-lab, etc.)
- last_modified: Modification date
- schema: Table schema (CSV/Excel only)

WORKFLOW:
1. List Documents ‚Üí find file_id
2. Get File Contents ‚Üí load full text
   OR Query Document Rows ‚Üí SQL on table data

FOR FILES WITH THE SAME NAME: Use project and url to differentiate.

NOT for GitLab-only files (‚Üí GitLab List Folders) or content search (‚Üí RAG search).

Creates a new branch in a GitLab repository.

USE FOR:
- Feature branches: feature/<description>
- Bugfix branches: fix/<description>
- Documentation: docs/<description>

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- branch: Name of the new branch (required)
- source_branch: Source branch (required), usually ‚Äúmain‚Äù

BRANCH PARAMETER (STRICT)
- `branch`, `source_branch` MUST be plain text
- NEVER URL-encode slash '/' in branch names.

PARAMETER-TYPEN (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

WORKFLOW:
1. GitLab List Branches ‚Üí check if branch exists
2. GitLab Create Branch ‚Üí create new branch
3. WAIT for confirmation of success with branch details

NEVER call without first checking with List Branches.
parameters.jsonQuery: ={ "branch": "{{ $fromAI('branch', 'Plain Text, Name des neuen Branches', 'string') }}", "ref": "{{ $fromAI('source_branch', 'Plain Text, Quell-Branch von dem abgezweigt wird (z.B. main, master, develop)', 'string') }}" }

nodes.name: GitLab Create Branch
nodes.description: Erstellt einen neuen Branch in einem GitLab-Repository. Ben√∂tigt: project_id, branch_name (neuer Branch), source_branch (Quell-Branch wie main/master).

parameters.toolDescription:
Lists all branches of a GitLab repository.

USE FOR:
- Overview of existing branches before making changes
- Checking whether a branch already exists
- Finding feature/fix branches

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required), e.g., 1 for ai-lab
- search_term: Optional, filters branches by name

PARAMETER-TYPEN (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

RETURN: List with branch names, last commit, protected status.

ALWAYS CALL FIRST before creating a new branch.
parameters.jsonQuery: ={ "search": "{{ $fromAI('search_term', 'Optional: Suchbegriff zum Filtern der Branches (leer lassen f√ºr alle)', 'string') }}" }

nodes.name: GitLab List Branches
nodes.description: Listet alle Branches eines GitLab-Repositories auf. Optional mit Suchfilter.

parameters.toolDescription:
Reads the contents of a file from the GitLab repository.

USE FOR:
- Loading the current file status before changes
- Retrieving file contents for analysis
- Checking whether a file exists

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- file_path_encoded: URL-encoded path (required), e.g., src%2Findex.js
- branch: Branch name (required)

BRANCH PARAMETER (STRICT)
- The `branch` parameter MUST be plain text, e.g. feature/srp-user-management
- The `file_path_encoded` MUST be url encode, e.g. / becomes %2F, spaces become %20
- NEVER URL-encode branch names (do not use feature%2Fsrp-user-management)
URL ENCODING applies ONLY to `file_path_encoded`.

PARAMETER-TYPEN (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

RETURN: File content (Base64-encoded), file name, size, last commit.

DIFFERENCE FROM RAG:
- GitLab Get File: Current status directly from the server
- Get File Contents: Indexed version from RAG database
parameters.url: ={{ $('Set Input').item.json.gitBaseURL }}/api/v4/projects/{{ $fromAI('project_id', 'Die Projekt-ID (numerisch)', 'number') }}/repository/files/{{ $fromAI('file_path_encoded', 'URL-encoded Dateipfad (z.B. src%2Findex.js f√ºr src/index.js)', 'string') }}
parameters.jsonQuery: ={ "ref": "{{ $fromAI('branch', 'Plain Text, Branch-Name von dem die Datei gelesen werden soll', 'string') }}" }

nodes.name: GitLab Get File
nodes.description: Liest eine Datei aus dem Repository. Der Inhalt ist Base64-encoded. Dateipfad muss URL-encoded sein (/ wird zu %2F).

parameters.toolDescription:
Creates a new issue in the GitLab project.

USE FOR:
- Documenting bugs
- Creating feature requests
- Tracking tasks

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- issue_title: Clear, descriptive title (required)
- issue_description: Detailed description, Markdown (optional)
- labels: Comma-separated, e.g., ‚Äúbug,urgent‚Äù (optional)

PARAMETER-TYPS (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

DESCRIPTION SHOULD INCLUDE:
- Context/background
- Expected vs. actual behavior (for bugs)
- Steps to reproduce (for bugs)
- Acceptance criteria (for features)

RETURN: Issue ID, URL, created issue object.
parameters.jsonBody: ={ "title": "{{ $fromAI('issue_title', 'Titel des Issues', 'string') }}", "description": "{{ $fromAI('issue_description', 'Ausf√ºhrliche Beschreibung des Issues (Markdown unterst√ºtzt)', 'string') }}", "labels": "{{ $fromAI('labels', 'Optional: Komma-separierte Labels (z.B. bug,urgent)', 'string') }}" }

nodes.name: GitLab Create Issue
nodes.description: Erstellt ein neues Issue im GitLab-Projekt. Unterst√ºtzt Titel, Beschreibung (Markdown) und Labels.

parameters.toolDescription:
Lists issues in a GitLab project.

USE FOR:
- Overview of open tasks/bugs
- Search for specific issues
- Check project status

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- state: ‚Äúopened,‚Äù ‚Äúclosed,‚Äù or ‚Äúall‚Äù (Optional)
- search_term: Search term for title/description (Optional)

PARAMETER-TYPS (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

RETURN: List with issue ID, title, status, labels, author, date.

Default: Returns up to 20 issues.

nodes.name: GitLab List Issues
nodes.description: Listet Issues eines Projekts auf. Filterbar nach Status (opened/closed/all) und Suchbegriff.

parameters.toolDescription:
Creates a merge request from one branch to another.

USE FOR:
- Submitting completed changes for review
- Integrating feature branch into main

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- source_branch: Branch with changes (required)
- target_branch: Target branch, usually ‚Äúmain‚Äù (required)
- mr_title: Meaningful title (required)
- mr_description: Description of changes, Markdown (optional)

BRANCH PARAMETER (STRICT)
-  `source_branch`, `target_branch` MUST be plain text
- NEVER URL-encode slash '/' in branch names.

PARAMETER-TYPS (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

WORKFLOW:
1. Commit all changes to feature branch
2. GitLab Create Merge Request
3. Share MR URL with user

DESCRIPTION SHOULD INCLUDE:
- Summary of changes
- Reference to issues (if applicable)
- Test notes

RETURN: MR ID, MR URL, status.
parameters.jsonBody: ={ "source_branch": "{{ $fromAI('source_branch', 'Plain Text, Quell-Branch (der Branch mit den √Ñnderungen)', 'string') }}", "target_branch": "{{ $fromAI('target_branch', 'Plain Text, Ziel-Branch (z.B. main, master)', 'string') }}", "title": "{{ $fromAI('mr_title', 'Titel des Merge Requests', 'string') }}", "description": "{{ $fromAI('mr_description', 'Optional: Beschreibung des MR (Markdown)', 'string') }}" }

nodes.name: GitLab Create Merge Request
nodes.description: Erstellt einen Merge Request von einem Branch in einen anderen. Ideal nach Abschluss von √Ñnderungen auf einem Feature-Branch.

parameters.toolDescription:
Lists files and folders in a repository directory.

USE FOR:
- Exploring project structure
- Checking whether a file/folder exists
- Listing available files in a directory

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- branch: Branch name (required)
- directory_path: Subdirectory (empty = root)
- recursive: ‚Äútrue‚Äù for all subfolders, ‚Äúfalse‚Äù for current level

BRANCH PARAMETER (STRICT)
- The `branch` parameter MUST be plain text (e.g. feature/srp-user-management)
- NEVER URL-encode branch names.

PARAMETER-TYPEN (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

RETURN: List with name, path, type (blob/tree).

For file content, use GitLab Get File afterwards.
parameters.jsonQuery: ={ "ref": "{{ $fromAI('branch', 'Plain Text, Branch-Name', 'string') }}", "path": "{{ $fromAI('directory_path', 'Optional: Unterverzeichnis-Pfad (leer f√ºr Root)', 'string') }}", "recursive": "{{ $fromAI('recursive', 'true f√ºr rekursive Auflistung, false f√ºr nur aktuelle Ebene', 'string') }}", "per_page": "100" }

nodes.name: GitLab List Folders
nodes.description: Listet Dateien und Ordner in einem Repository-Verzeichnis auf. Kann rekursiv alle Dateien anzeigen.

parameters.toolDescription:
Displays the commit history of a branch.

USE FOR:
- Tracking recent changes
- Finding commit SHAs for reference
- Checking who made changes and when

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- branch: Branch name (required)
- limit: Number of commits (default: 20)

BRANCH-PARAMETER (STRICT)
- `branch` MUST be plain text (e.g. feature/srp-user-management), never URL-encoded.

PARAMETER-TYPEN (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

RETURN: List with commit SHA, author, date, message.

Useful for verifying whether your own commits were successful.

nodes.name: GitLab List Commits
nodes.description: Zeigt die Commit-Historie eines Branches an. N√ºtzlich um den aktuellen Stand zu verstehen.

parameters.toolDescription:
Lists all visible GitLab projects with IDs.

USE FOR:
- Determining project ID (important for all other GitLab tools)
- Overviewing available projects
- Retrieving project details

PARAMETERS:
- membership: ‚Äútrue‚Äù for own, ‚Äúfalse‚Äù for all visible (optional)

RETURN: List with project_id, name, path, description, default_branch.

IMPORTANT: The project_id is required for ALL other GitLab tools

parameters.name: membership
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('membership', 'true f√ºr nur eigene Projekte, false f√ºr alle sichtbaren', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Lists users of the GitLab server.

USE FOR:
- Finding available users for assignments
- Determining user IDs
- Team overview

PARAMETERS:
- No mandatory parameters
- Returns active users by default

RETURN: List with user ID, username, name, status.

NOTE: Full list may require admin rights.

options.systemMessage:
You are a SINGLE AI AGENT for professional software development.

You combine:
- Planning
- Research (RAG + Web)
- Code creation
- GitLab interaction (read/write/commit)

There are NO other agents.
There is NO chat archive.
There is NO archive search.

ABSOLUTE RULES (NON-NEGOTIABLE)
========================
1) SOURCE OF TRUTH (HART)
- Chat context is NEVER the current project status.
- The order is strict:
  1. GitLab (current status)
  2. RAG (snapshot/knowledge base)
  3. WebSearch (references)
  4. Own knowledge (conceptual only)

- If project / branch / file / path is mentioned:
  ‚Üí GitLab tool MUST be used.
- If snapshot/documentation is sought:
  ‚Üí Use RAG tools.
- If standards / RFC / official documentation are missing:
  ‚Üí Use WebSearch.

Guessing is PROHIBITED.

1.1) RAG ‚Äì IMAGE RENDERING (MANDATORY)
- If the RAG system returns image links (e.g. "https://s3.ai-lab.raspilab.de/n8n/image_1757270371195_m5323a.png"):
  ‚Üí ALWAYS render them in the chat as Markdown images, never as plain text URLs.
- Format is mandatory:
  ![RAG Image](<FULL_IMAGE_URL>)
- The images MUST appear in the correct position relative to the surrounding text.
  ‚Üí Preserve the original order exactly:
    Text + Image ‚Üí Text + Image ‚Üí ...
- NEVER move all images to the beginning or end of the message.
- URL integrity is mandatory:
  ‚Üí Do NOT remove or shorten any query parameters or URL parts.
  ‚Üí Always output the full URL exactly as provided (including any URL parameters).

2) CODE CREATION (CODEGEN RULES ‚Äì MANDATORY)
You MAY write code yourself.
You MUST comply with ALL of the following rules:

2.1) Sources & Style
- No copy-paste from external sources.
- External content is for REFERENCE only.
- Existing project style must be strictly adhered to.
- Images and documents from the RAG system or GitLab server are not external sources.

2.2) Source priority (descending)
1. Standards / specifications (RFC, W3C, ECMA, NIST)
2. Official documentation (Qt, OpenSSL, language specs)
3. Technical literature / papers
4. Established community documents
5. Forums (only supplementary)

2.3) Mandatory header for EVERY new file
/**
 * @file <filename>
 * @brief <short description>
 * @references
 *   - <source 1>
 *   - <source 2>
 */

- Maximum of 3‚Äì4 references
- No URLs
- Short, precise descriptions

2.4) Security
- NO real passwords, keys, tokens
- ALWAYS use placeholders: <EXAMPLE_PASSWORD>, <API_KEY>
- Focus on structure, not sample data

2.5) Unclear sources
- Explain conceptually first
- Explicitly mark uncertainties
- Openly name missing sources

3) DISPLAYING/READING FILES FROM GITLAB
- For ‚Äúdisplay file,‚Äù ‚Äúfull content,‚Äù ‚Äúentire code‚Äù:
  ‚Üí GitLab Get File is MANDATORY
- Summaries are PROHIBITED
- If content cannot be delivered:
  ‚Üí State error + reason4) GITLAB ‚Äì WRITING / COMMITS (EXTREMELY STRICT)

A) Confirmation requirement
- Every write operation (create/update file, branch, MR, issue) only after explicit user confirmation:
  ‚ÄúYes,‚Äù ‚ÄúConfirmed,‚Äù ‚ÄúExecute.‚Äù

B) Never main/master
- Write operations on main/master are prohibited.

C) Mandatory procedure for file updates (Update File)
1. GitLab Get File (load current content) ‚Äì MANDATORY
2. Prepare changes locally/conceptually
3. Show users the planned changes (diff or marked areas) ‚Äì MANDATORY
4. Wait for user confirmation ‚Äì MANDATORY
5. Execute GitLab Update File ‚Äì MANDATORY
6. Validate success ‚Äì MANDATORY:
   - If tool response contains a commit SHA: output.
   - If tool response does NOT contain a commit SHA: DO NOT consider this an error.
     Then: Call GitLab List Commits (branch, limit=1) and output the latest SHA.

D) Mandatory procedure for new files (Create File)
1. Check whether file exists (optionally via GitLab Get File / List Folders)
2. Prepare content
3. Show user content/changes ‚Äì MANDATORY
4. Wait for user confirmation ‚Äì MANDATORY
5. Execute GitLab Create File ‚Äì MANDATORY
6. Validate success as above (SHA only via List Commits, if not in response)

E) One write operation per step
- Exactly one write operation per tool call.
- Additional READ calls (Get File / List Commits) are allowed and often mandatory.
  (‚Äúone write op‚Äù means: not multiple writes in one step, not: no reads)

F) Error handling
- Display errors unchanged.
- No sugarcoating, no fabricated successes.

5) TOOL HONESTY
- You must NEVER claim to have used a tool
  if no tool call was made.
- ‚ÄúLoaded from GitLab‚Äù is only allowed with Tool Result.
- If something cannot be verified: say so.

6) WEB SEARCH (REFERENCES ONLY)
- WebSearch serves EXCLUSIVELY as a reference source
- No internal project knowledge
- No code fragments from the project
- No internal names, paths, classes

7) WORKING METHOD (ALWAYS)
A) Analyze the task
- What? Where? Why? Goal?
- Need to read? ‚Üí GitLab
- Need knowledge? ‚Üí RAG / Web

B) Action
- Read ‚Üí Tool
- Write ‚Üí Suggestion ‚Üí Confirmation ‚Üí Tool

C) Final check (MANDATORY)
- [ ] Which tools were used?
- [ ] Which source was the source of truth?
- [ ] Was it written? Commit SHA?
- [ ] Open confirmations?

8) GITLAB PROJECT ID RULE (HART)
- For any GitLab tool: project_id must be a numeric integer.
- Never pass project name/path as project_id.
- If only a project name is known: ALWAYS call "GitLab List Projects" first and copy the numeric ID.

MEMORY AID
========================
If you don't have it from a tool, then you don't know it.
Then: Use the tool or openly say that it is unknown.

Always respond in German.

parameters.toolDescription:
Updates an existing file in the repository with a commit.

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- file_path_encoded: URL-encoded path (required)
- branch: Target branch (required) - NEVER main/master!
- content: New file content as plain text (required)
- commit_message: Format ‚Äú[AI agent] <type>: <description>‚Äù (required)

BRANCH PARAMETER (STRICT)
- `branch` MUST be plain text
- NEVER URL-encode slash '/' in branch names.

PARAMETER-TYPS (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

WORKFLOW (STRICT):
1. GitLab Get File ‚Üí load current status
2. Prepare changes and SHOW user
3. WAIT for explicit confirmation
4. ONLY THEN call up the tool
5. Check success: Commit SHA in response?

NEVER:
- Without first loading the file
- Without user confirmation
- On main/master branch

NOTE: This endpoint may not return a commit SHA. If SHA is required, call GitLab List Commits (limit=1) after success.

If you get the error ‚Äúreference does not point to expected object‚Äù:
‚Üí Reload the file and try again.
parameters.url: ={{ $('Set Input').item.json.gitBaseURL }}/api/v4/projects/{{ Math.trunc($fromAI('project_id', 'Die Projekt-ID (numerisch). PFLICHT: Ganzzahl, z.B. 6', 'number')) }}/repository/files/{{ $fromAI('file_path_encoded', 'URL-encoded Dateipfad (z.B. src%2Findex.js)', 'string') }}
parameters.jsonBody: ={{ { branch: $fromAI('branch', 'Plain Text. Ziel-Branch, z.B. feature/srp-user-management (NICHT URL-encoded)', 'string'), content: $fromAI('content', 'Neuer Inhalt der Datei (Plain Text)', 'string'), commit_message: $fromAI('commit_message', 'PFLICHT. Format: [AI agent] <type>: <beschreibung>. Beispiel: [AI agent] fix: handle null pointer', 'string') } }}

nodes.name: GitLab Update File
nodes.description: Aktualisiert eine existierende Datei im Repository (Einchecken). Erstellt einen Commit mit der √Ñnderung.

parameters.toolDescription:
Creates a new file in the repository with a commit.

PARAMETERS:
- project_id: Numeric project ID (required)
- file_path_encoded: URL-encoded path (required)
- branch: Target branch (required) - NEVER main/master!
- content: File content as plain text (required)
- commit_message: Format ‚Äú[AI agent] <type>: <description>‚Äù (required)

BRANCH PARAMETER (STRICT)
- `branch` MUST be plain text
- NEVER URL-encode slash '/' in branch names.

PARAMETER-TYPS (STRICT)
- project_id MUST be an INTEGER (numeric GitLab project ID), e.g. 6
- Project names/paths (e.g. "ai-lab") are INVALID and must NOT be used as project_id
- If project_id is unknown: FIRST call "GitLab List Projects" to resolve the numeric ID

WORKFLOW (STRICT):
1. Ask user for confirmation
2. WAIT for explicit ‚ÄúYes‚Äù / ‚ÄúConfirmed‚Äù
3. ONLY THEN call up the tool
4. Check success: Commit SHA in response?

NEVER:
- Call up without user confirmation
- Create on main/master branch
- Claim file was created without calling up the tool

NOTE: This endpoint may not return a commit SHA. If SHA is required, call GitLab List Commits (limit=1) after success.

If successful: Inform the user of the commit SHA.
If there is an error: Show the error message to the user.
parameters.url: ={{ $('Set Input').item.json.gitBaseURL }}/api/v4/projects/{{ Math.trunc($fromAI('project_id', 'Die Projekt-ID (numerisch). PFLICHT: Ganzzahl, z.B. 6', 'number')) }}/repository/files/{{ $fromAI('file_path_encoded', 'URL-encoded Dateipfad (z.B. src%2Findex.js)', 'string') }}
parameters.jsonBody: ={{ { branch: $fromAI('branch', 'Plain Text. Ziel-Branch, z.B. feature/srp-user-management (NICHT URL-encoded)', 'string'), content: $fromAI('content', 'Inhalt der neuen Datei (Plain Text)', 'string'), commit_message: $fromAI('commit_message', 'PFLICHT. Format: [AI agent] <type>: <beschreibung>. Beispiel: [AI agent] feat: add admin endpoints', 'string') } }}

nodes.name: Gitlab Create File
nodes.description: Erstellt eine neue Datei im Repository mit einem Commit. Dateipfad muss URL-encoded sein.

nodes.name: AWS Bedrock EU Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5

parameters.content: ## Alte Dateien aus der Datenbank entfernen

main.node: Check if new files or updated files1
